attributes.action: Make the NMC retention fee payable by monthly direct debit.
attributes.additional_details: While this was an unpopular decision, consideration must be taken into account that nurses have not received a pay rise in well over 5 years. The NMC should be made so that we can pay our retention fees on a monthly direct debit basis to ease the burden as many of us are struggling. There is no reason this can not be done.
attributes.background: As we are all aware the NMC have increased their retention fees, the first hike was in 2012 from £75 to £100. The second hike in 2014 from £100 to £125. Both increases were well above the rate of inflation and left many of us struggling to pay.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for the Nursing and Midwifery Council. 

You could raise this issue with the NMC directly using the contact details on the following website: https://www.nmc.org.uk/contact-us/
